message.content:
cs.IT, cs.ITP, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with information theory, specifically with entropy and its applications in guessing and source coding. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also involves cryptography (as it mentions the guessing problem), which falls under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also involves probability theory and statistics, which could fall under cs.ITP (Information Theory and Probability) or cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms). Finally, the paper discusses source coding, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
